pages.title: Tulip
pages.text: A Tulip is a vanilla flower species that can be hybridized into new colors when a filled pollen jar is used on a vanilla Tulip.$(br2)Orange Tulip Pollen Jars will produce orange or blue hybridized seeds.$(br)Pink Tulip Pollen Jars will produce pink or lavender hybridized seeds.$(br)Red Tulip Pollen Jars will produce red or peach hybridized seeds.$(br)White Tulip Pollen Jars will produce white or light blue hybridized seeds.

pages.title: Hybridized Seeds
pages.text: Use any of the Pollen Jars on a vanilla Tulip to obtain hybridized Tulip Seeds, with an uncommon chance of obtaining hybridized Bougainvillea, Jasmine, Hyacinth, or Clematis Seeds based on the vanilla Tulip color.

pages.name: Red Tulip
pages.text: Red flowers are from cross-pollination with Poppy, Red Tulip, or Rose Bush Pollen Jars.

pages.name: Orange Tulip
pages.text: Orange flowers are from cross-pollination with Orange Tulip or Torchflower Pollen Jars.

pages.name: Yellow Tulip
pages.text: Yellow flowers are from cross-pollination with Dandelion or Sunflower Pollen Jars.

pages.name: Lime Tulip
pages.text: Lime flowers are an uncommon mutation from cross-pollination with Dandelion or Sunflower Pollen Jars.

pages.name: Mint Tulip
pages.text: Mint flowers are an uncommon mutation from cross-pollination with Blue Orchid Pollen Jars.

pages.name: Cyan Tulip
pages.text: Cyan flowers are from cross-pollination with Pitcher Plant Pollen Jars.

pages.name: Blue Tulip
pages.text: Blue flowers are from cross-pollination with Cornflower Pollen Jars.

pages.name: Light Blue Tulip
pages.text: Light blue flowers are from cross-pollination with Blue Orchid Pollen Jars.

pages.name: Lavender Tulip
pages.text: Lavender flowers are an uncommon mutation from cross-pollination with Peony, Pink Petals, and Pink Tulip Pollen Jars.

pages.name: Purple Tulip
pages.text: Purple flowers are an uncommon mutation from cross-pollination with Pitcher Plant and Cornflower Pollen Jars.

pages.name: Lilac Tulip
pages.text: Lilac flowers are an uncommon mutation from cross-pollination with Allium and Lilac Pollen Jars.

pages.name: Magenta Tulip
pages.text: Magenta flowers are from cross-pollination with Allium and Lilac Pollen Jars.

pages.name: Pink Tulip
pages.text: Pink flowers are from cross-pollination with Peony, Pink Petals, and Pink Tulip Pollen Jars.

pages.name: Peach Tulip
pages.text: Peach flowers are an uncommon mutation from cross-pollination with Poppy, Red Tulip, or Rose Bush Pollen Jars.

pages.name: Multicolor Tulip
pages.text: Multicolor flowers are a rare mutation from cross-pollination with any of the Pollen Jars.

pages.name: White Tulip
pages.text: White flowers are from cross-pollination with Azure Bluet, Lily of the Valley, Oxeye Daisy, and White Tulip Pollen Jars.

pages.name: Black Tulip
pages.text: Black flowers are from cross-pollination with Wither Rose Pollen Jars.

pages.name: Wilted Tulip
pages.text: Wilted flowers are an uncommon mutation from cross-pollination with Wither Rose Pollen Jars.
